headline: Etsy Sells Depop To Refocus On Core Marketplace And Valuation Potential
summary: Etsy (NYSE:ETSY) agreed to sell Depop to eBay for US$1.2b. The deal allows Etsy to focus more tightly on its core handmade and creative goods marketplace. Management highlighted that the core marketplace has recently returned to positive growth. Etsy runs a global marketplace focused on handmade, vintage, and creative goods, which sets it apart from larger generalist e commerce platforms. The sale of Depop removes a separate, fashion focused resale business from the mix and had been a...

headline: eBay announces workforce reduction amid business restructuring
summary: eBay Inc (NASDAQ:EBAY, XETRA:EBA) said on Thursday that it will cut roughly 6% of its global workforce, or about 800 employees, as part of a company-wide effort to reduce costs and realign operations. “We are taking steps to reinvest across our business and align our structure with our...

headline: Curious Orange Strengthens U.S. Leadership with Jess Wehage and Google and eBay Veteran Shawn Mielke
summary: SAN FRANCISCO, February 26, 2026--Curious Orange, an independent digital marketing agency with a global footprint, today announced two major additions to its U.S. leadership team as it continues to expand across North America. The agency has appointed former Instrument leader Jess Wehage as U.S. Managing Director and longtime Google and eBay executive Shawn Mielke as Co-Founder and board member.

raw.headline: Curious Orange Strengthens U.S. Leadership with Jess Wehage and Google and eBay Veteran Shawn Mielke

headline: EBay to Cut 800 Jobs in Strategic Restructuring
summary: The online auction site didn’t say when the layoffs are expected to occur, or whether the company expects to record any charges as a result of the restructuring.

headline: EBay Stock Is Trending Today: What's Going On?
summary: EBay Inc (NASDAQ:EBAY) shares are trading higher on Thursday even as the company announced it will cut about 800 jobs, roughly 6% of its full‑time workforce, as part of an effort to realign staffing with its strategic priorities. Here's what you may want to know.

headline: Ebay slashes 6% of workforce as e-commerce firm realigns operations
summary: Ebay said on Thursday it is cutting about 800 jobs, or roughly ‌6% of its full‑time workforce, ‌as the e‑commerce company moves to streamline operations ​and align staffing with its strategic priorities.  "We are taking steps to reinvest across our business and align our structure ‌with our ⁠strategic priorities, which will affect certain roles across our workforce," ⁠the company said.  Here are some details:  * EBay will cut about 800 jobs, ​or 6% ​of its ​full-timeworkforce, as part ‌of a restructuring aimed at aligning staffingwith long‑term strategic priorities.

headline: eBay Weighs Culture Reset And Gen Z Growth With Depop Deal
summary: eBay (NasdaqGS:EBAY) has settled a high profile harassment lawsuit involving company employees and executives, closing a multi year legal dispute. The case had drawn wide attention to eBay's internal culture, oversight processes, and responsibility for employee conduct. Separately, eBay announced an agreement to acquire Depop, a fashion resale platform with a strong Gen Z user base. The Depop deal is designed to extend eBay's reach in the resale and recommerce market and deepen its presence...

headline: Carolyn Bertozzi Rocks Out Solving Chemistry's Biggest Mysteries
summary: Carolyn Bertozzi is a matchmaker of sorts, but not in the romantic sense.  Bertozzi, 59, is a Nobel Prize-winning scientist who figured out how to bring together two or more molecules to form a new bond within the cells of living organisms without interrupting the cell's normal processes.  Thanks to her research, scientists now can find ways to explore how complex carbohydrates form or mutate on the surface of cells in living things.

headline: EBay laying off about 800 roles, or 6% of its workforce
summary: The job cuts are occurring across the company, and are a result of its push to focus on "strategic priorities," eBay said.
